DataElement.preferredName: Planned Antitumor Agent with Radiation Therapy and Adjuvant Temozolomide Administration Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: YN Indicator to specify if patient is planning to receive therapeutic antitumor agents in addition to standard radiation, and concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Planned Antitumor Agent with Radiation Therapy and Adjuvant Temozolomide Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: To devise, contrive, or form in design._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Relating to or involved in therapy._Having to do with stopping abnormal cell growth._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Occurring or operating at the same time._An agent that enhances the activity or therapeutic effect of another pharmacologic substance without having much, if any, therapeutic impact by itself._A triazene analog of dacarbazine with antineoplastic activity.  As a cytotoxic alkylating agent, temozolomide is converted at physiologic pH to the short-lived active compound, monomethyl triazeno imidazole carboxamide (MTIC). The cytotoxicity of MTIC is due primarily to methylation of DNA at the O6 and N7 positions of guanine, resulting in inhibition of DNA replication. Unlike dacarbazine, which is metabolized to MITC only in the liver, temozolomide is metabolized to MITC at all sites. Temozolomide is administered orally and penetrates well into the central nervous system. (NCI04)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.:Relating to or involved in therapy.:Having to do with stopping abnormal cell growth.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
Relating to or involved in therapy.
Having to do with stopping abnormal cell growth.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredName: With Radiation Therapy Concurrent Adjuvant Temozolomide Administration
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Occurring or operating at the same time.:An agent that enhances the activity or therapeutic effect of another pharmacologic substance without having much, if any, therapeutic impact by itself.:A triazene analog of dacarbazine with antineoplastic activity.  As a cytotoxic alkylating agent, temozolomide is converted at physiologic pH to the short-lived active compound, monomethyl triazeno imidazole carboxamide (MTIC). The cytotoxicity of MTIC is due primarily to methylation of DNA at the O6 and N7 positions of guanine, resulting in inhibition of DNA replication. Unlike dacarbazine, which is metabolized to MITC only in the liver, temozolomide is metabolized to MITC at all sites. Temozolomide is administered orally and penetrates well into the central nervous system. (NCI04):The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Occurring or operating at the same time.
An agent that enhances the activity or therapeutic effect of another pharmacologic substance without having much, if any, therapeutic impact by itself.

A triazene analog of dacarbazine with antineoplastic activity.  As a cytotoxic alkylating agent, temozolomide is converted at physiologic pH to the short-lived active compound, monomethyl triazeno imidazole carboxamide (MTIC). The cytotoxicity of MTIC is due primarily to methylation of DNA at the O6 and N7 positions of guanine, resulting in inhibition of DNA replication. Unlike dacarbazine, which is metabolized to MITC only in the liver, temozolomide is metabolized to MITC at all sites. Temozolomide is administered orally and penetrates well into the central nervous system. (NCI04)
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patients planning to receive
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients planning to receive therapeutic antitumor agents in addition to standard radiation, and concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide are not eligible to participate in this study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: v2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients planning to receive therapeutic antitumor agents (excluding use of the Tumor Treating Fields (TTFields or Optune(R)) device after the Month 1 Post RT (10 wk) Neurocognitive-PRO assessment) in addition to standard radiation and concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide are not eligible to participate in this study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: v3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients planning to receive therapeutic antitumor agents (excluding use of the Tumor Treating Fields (TTFields or OptuneÂ®) device after the Month 1 Post RT (10 wk) Neurocognitive-PRO assessment.) in addition to standard radiation and concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide are not eligible to participate in this study.
